Build a greenhouse: A greenhouse is a great way to regulate indoor temperature without using heaters or air conditioners. You can use transparent plastic or glass walls and a roof to trap heat from the sun during the day and release it at night. This will help maintain a comfortable temperature inside. Use passive solar design: By designing your home with passive solar principles in mind, you can take advantage of natural heating and cooling. For example, you can use south-facing windows to capture sunlight during the winter and absorb heat, while using shades or blinds to block out the sun during the summer to keep the house cool. Confidence score: 0.9

Utilize phase change materials: Phase change materials (PCMs) are materials that can absorb and release heat as they change phase from solid to liquid or vice versa.
